metadata.dc:author: Valtueña Borque, Oscar
metadata.dc:description: Till the date all critiziens and curators of the Spanish painter Bartolomé Esteban Murillo (1617-1682) have not found papers written before relating his provocative scenes of childhood. It was said they were fantastic ideas of the painter. The author begining with the basket (or esportilla) on the Velázquez picture Old woman friyng eggs, done a careful study of the Miguel de Cervantes (1547-1616) books. In these way he found phrases written before the Murillo childhood pictures, included those with a clair sexual context.
metadata.dc:title: Cervantes y Murillo referentes de la infancia Española en la edad de oro.
[The Spanish writer Cervantes and the painter Murillo as references of the Spanish childhood in the golden age].
metadata.dc:publisher: Anales de la Real Academia Nacional de Medicina
